intro: Buchnera bowalensis, commonly known as the Bowal's Buchnera, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white to pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Buchnera bowalensis is typically found growing in sandy soils along the coast, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained conditions.
